Title: Anya – The Widow
Description: I can gather the widows to sew memorial banners, but it will pull them from work.

Title: Anya – The Widow
Description: I keep a small stash of candles for the dead; I can share them or save them for harsher nights.

Title: Arthur – The Generator Chief
Description: I can reroute extra steam to the housing blocks, but it will strain the vents.

Title: Arthur – The Generator Chief
Description: I can schedule an emergency shutdown for deep maintenance, but the city will freeze for a while.

Title: Harrow – The Explorer Admiral
Description: I can redirect scouts to search for lost families instead of resources, if you wish.

Title: Harrow – The Explorer Admiral
Description: I spotted a frozen convoy; I can risk a quick salvage or map it for later.

Title: Eleanor – The Teacher
Description: I can turn the classroom into a warm storytelling circle tonight, but we will burn extra coal.

Title: Eleanor – The Teacher
Description: I can add safety drills to our lessons, though it might frighten the younger ones.

Title: Elior – The Faith Enforcer
Description: I can call for a strict fast, claiming sacrifice will earn salvation.

Title: Elior – The Faith Enforcer
Description: I can post watchful acolytes in the streets to correct doubtful talk.

Title: Maeve – The Cook
Description: I can spice the stew with the last herbs to lift spirits, though they won’t last.

Title: Maeve – The Cook
Description: I can serve a thin extra meal at night or keep rations strict and stable.

Title: Nikolai – The Archivist
Description: I can publicly display old laws from the Old World, or keep them locked in the archive.

Title: Nikolai – The Archivist
Description: I can compile a Book of the Fallen and read names aloud each week.

Title: Oleg – The Smuggler
Description: I can bring in a batch of coal from questionable sources, no questions asked.

Title: Oleg – The Smuggler
Description: I can smuggle a few desperate families into the city if you turn a blind eye.

Title: Silas – The Inventor
Description: I can build a crude automaton from scrap to help, though it might fail catastrophically.

Title: Silas – The Inventor
Description: I can retrofit heaters in the infirmary or in the workers’ barracks, but not both.

Title: Jonas – The Captain
Description: I can enforce a nightly curfew to keep order, though people will resent it.

Title: Jonas – The Captain
Description: I can lead a dangerous drill on the ice to prepare for attacks.

Title: Amara – The Chaplain
Description: I can open the chapel all night for those who can’t sleep.

Title: Amara – The Chaplain
Description: I can preach that suffering is holy, or instead speak softly about kindness.

Title: Lina – The Child
Description: I can help organize a game in the snow, even if some might catch a cold.

Title: Lina – The Child
Description: I can help the medics by bringing water and blankets, if you allow it.

Title: Unit C-7 “Hollow” – The Machine
Description: I can optimize coal distribution schedules, reducing comfort breaks.

Title: Unit C-7 “Hollow” – The Machine
Description: I can assign myself to constant generator monitoring or to medical triage support.

Title: Helena – The Medic
Description: I can tighten admission rules so only the worst cases get beds.

Title: Helena – The Medic
Description: I can train a few workers in basic first aid, though it will slow production.

Title: Malik – The Scout
Description: I can scout the crevasse the children talk about, or chase that weak radio echo again.

Title: Malik – The Scout
Description: I can mark a shortcut over thin ice, saving time but risking lives.

Title: Elias – The Steward
Description: I can introduce a food stamp system to track every portion given.

Title: Elias – The Steward
Description: I can quietly divert a small reserve for emergencies or put everything on public ledgers.

Title: The Stranger
Description: I can show you a path through the storm, but it will cost you in bodies, not in coal.

Title: The Stranger
Description: I can whisper a prophecy of coming calm, or of coming ruin; both will spread quickly.

Title: Mara – The Worker Representative
Description: I can call for a brief strike to demand safer gear.

Title: Mara – The Worker Representative
Description: I can promise the workers extra warmth later if they accept harsh hours now.

Title: Tomas – The Propagandist
Description: I can paint you as a stern savior or a gentle guardian in our posters.

Title: Tomas – The Propagandist
Description: I can censor bad news from the frontier or publish every grim detail.

Title: Vera – The Quartermaster
Description: I can issue heavier coats to the night shift, but we don’t have enough for everyone.

Title: Vera – The Quartermaster
Description: I can loosen the tallying rules to move supplies faster, or keep everything strictly counted.

Title: Arthur – The Last Ember
Description: You knew the core was dying. You saw the warnings, the frost creeping in… and you still pushed us into this cold grave. Why didn’t you listen?

Title: Arthur – The Melted Heart
Description: You wanted warmth so desperately that you burned the city alive. You told me to push harder… and now everything is ash. This was your call.

Title: Amara – Empty Chapel
Description: You drained them, piece by piece. Every choice you made tore hope from their hands. Even I cannot pray for what you’ve done to them… to us.

Title: Amara – Burning Faith
Description: You fed their faith until it blinded them. You told them what to believe, and they followed you into madness. Their worship has turned into a weapon—your weapon.

Title: Jonas – Silent Streets
Description: You crushed every voice, every doubt, every complaint. Now there’s nothing left but fear—and that fear is eating us alive. This silence… you created it.

Title: Jonas – Riot in the Snow
Description: They begged you to ease their suffering, and you ignored them. Now the city tears itself apart—and they scream your name with hatred. This riot is your legacy.

Title: Helena – The Last Patient
Description: One by one, they died under your watch. You had the power to save them… and you chose paths that led us here. I’m standing in an empty infirmary. You did this.

Title: Helena – Too Many to Save
Description: You opened the gates, again and again, without thinking what we could handle. Now the wounded drown us, and I can’t save them. This chaos… it’s your kindness turned cruel.
